thread.title: Lions rip Hornets, Mustangs nipped by Black Raiders in opening October battles
thread.title_full: Lions rip Hornets, Mustangs nipped by Black Raiders in opening October battles

author: news@courierpublicationsllc.com (Staff)
title: Lions rip Hornets, Mustangs nipped by Black Raiders in opening October battles
text:
Lions rip Hornets, Mustangs nipped by Black Raiders in opening October battles By Staff | Oct 02, 2015 
Only two goals were scored combined Thursday, Oct. 1 in games involving Waldo County field hockey squads as Belfast hosted Leavitt of Turner and Mount View traveled to face Winslow. 
Both home teams came away with victories as the Lions edged the Hornets 1-0, while the Black Raiders earned a 1-0 triumph over the Mustangs. 
Photos from the Belfast versus Leavitt game will appear later with this story. 
The following is a recap of both contests: 
Belfast 1, Leavitt 0 
At Belfast Oct. 1, the Lions broke a scoreless tie roughly 50 minutes into the contest and swung to their ninth win in 11 tries. The game was 0-0 at halftime. 
Kyle Nelson banged the back of the cage for Belfast with 9:34 left, which proved the difference. 
Morgan Fernald made four saves on five shots for the Lions, while Hailey DeMascio made seven saves on eight shots for the Hornets. Both teams attempted 10 penalty corners. 
The Belfast jayvees also posted a 2-1 win. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class B North, Belfast (9-2, 61.4286 points) is fifth, while Winslow (7-2-1, 85.6378 points) is first in the 14-team region. The top 10 teams qualify for the playoffs. 
Winslow 1, Mount View 0 
At Winslow Oct. 1, the Black Raiders edged the Mustangs in a game featuring the two teams atop Class B and Class C North, respectively. 
Cassidy Rickard scored the lone goal off the game with 8:50 left in the first half off a penalty corner for the Black Raiders. 
Alexis Bowman made nine saves on 10 shots for Mount View, while Delaney Wood made 12 saves on as shots for Winslow, including a penalty stroke by Reanna Boulay. 
Mount View held a 16-6 edge in penalty corners. 
The Winslow jayvees also posted a 4-1 win. 
In the Maine Principals' Association Heal Point Standings for Class C North, Mount View (7-4, 65.3571 points) is first in the 11-team region. The top eight teams qualify for the playoffs.
